title: The Most Common Workplace Injury
body:
Slips, trips, and falls are the most common cause of major injury in UK workplaces. In a kitchen, the risks are higher due to water, oil, food scraps, and busy movement.

Most of these accidents are preventable with good housekeeping and awareness.

title: Preventing Slips
body:
**Slips** happen when there is too little friction between footwear and the floor.

**Causes:** Wet floors, oil spills, flour/dust, wrong footwear.

**Prevention:**
- Clean up spills immediately.
- Use 'Wet Floor' signs (but remove them when dry).
- Wear slip-resistant shoes.
- Keep floors degreased.

title: Preventing Trips
body:
**Trips** happen when your foot hits an object or the surface is uneven.

**Causes:** Trailing cables, boxes in walkways, damaged floor tiles, poor lighting.

**Prevention:**
- Keep walkways clear.
- Manage cables (use covers or route them safely).
- Report damaged flooring.
- Ensure good lighting.

stem: You spill some oil on the floor during service. What should you do?
options: Leave it until the end of service
Throw a cardboard box over it
Clean it up immediately and use a wet floor sign
Tell someone else to do it later
rationale: Oil is extremely slippery. It must be cleaned immediately to prevent an accident.

title: Module Complete
body: You've learned how to prevent slips and trips. Keep floors clean, dry, and clear of obstacles to keep yourself and your team safe.
